title: This Day in Country Music: June 19
title_page: This Day in Country Music: June 19
maintext:
Today’s look back at country music >>>
1914 - Born on this day in Overton County, Tennessee, was Lester Flatt, bluegrass musician best known for his work in the Bluegrass duo The Foggy Mountain Boys. He was also known as “Flatt and Scruggs”
1954 - “I Don’t Hurt Anymore” by Hank Snow began a 20 week run at #1 on the Country Best Seller list
1956 - Born on this day, in Newnan, Georgia, was Doug Stone, country music artist who had the 1991 US #1 Country hit “In A Different Light.” Stone made his acting debut in the film Gordy
2001 - Lonestar released their fourth album I’m Already There
2006 - Gretchen Wilson and Josh Gracin performed for president George W. Bush along with 6,000 guests at the President’s Dinner at the Washington Convention Center
2008 - Loretta Lynn joined the Songwriters Hall of Fame during a ceremony at the Marriott Marquis Hotel in New York City. Anne Murray also received the Hitmaker Award
2010 - Dancer Dean Sheremet divorced Grammy Award-winning singer LeAnn Rimes after nearly eight years of marriage due to infidelity
2013 - Singer Slim Whitman, who reportedly once sold over 120 million records, passed away. He was 90
